definitions: To raise (children or animals) to maturity.
To care for and educate (a child) until maturity.
To bring up and train (a person or animal).
To stand up on the hind legs (especially of a horse).
To lift something to an upright position.
examples: She decided to rear her children in the countryside.
The mare reared up when it heard the loud noise.
They plan to rear a new monument in the town square.
He helped to rear the tent pole.
